sentence.Network_en: This factor will come increasingly to the fore as election day nears.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着选举日的临近，这一因素将愈发重要。

sentence.Network_en: Our yacht was well equipped with two double cabins fore and aft.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的游艇设施完备，首尾有两个双人舱。

sentence.Network_en: The fore end tube plate of the condenser has cracked beyond repair.
sentence.Network_cn: 冷凝器前端破裂得无法修理了.

A、木材用途与特性: 1、虎纹和鸟眼枫木(Curly & Birdseye Maple): &nb... 最常被使用在球杆前臂(Fore Arm)和不缠线握把(Unwrapped Handles)上及握把下方的袖套.

jx.jx_en_mean: In, into, or toward a position of prominence
jx.jx_cn_mean: 出名：处于、进入或朝向一个显赫的位置

lj.lj_ly: A new virtuoso has come to the fore.
lj.lj_ls: 已成为显赫人物的新艺术品鉴赏家

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (as a preposition, also in the sense 'before in time, previously'): of Germanic origin; related to Dutch voor and German vor. The adjective and noun represent the prefix fore- used independently (late 15th cent.)

entry.def: If someone or something comes to the fore in a particular situation or group, they become important or popular.

example.ex: A number of low-budget independent films brought new directors and actors to the fore.
example.tran: 许多低成本独立制作的电影使新导演和新演员崭露头角。

entry.tran: (动物、船只或飞行器)前部的，前端的
entry.def: Fore is used to refer to parts at the front of an animal, ship, or aircraft.

example.ex: There had been no direct damage in the fore part of the ship.
example.tran: 船的前部没有受到直接破坏。

example.ex: ...a swelling appeared below his near fore knee.
example.tran: 左前腿膝关节下出现的一个肿块

entry.def: If something is fore in a boat or plane, it is at the front of it.

example.ex: Our yacht was well equipped with two double cabins fore and aft...
example.tran: 我们的游艇设施完备，首尾有两个双人舱。

example.ex: He loosened his very strong hold on the ship's rail and glanced fore and aft.
example.tran: 他松开紧紧抓住护栏的手，往船的两头扫了一眼。

means.word_mean: 1. front part of a vessel or aircraft;

sentences.sentence: "he pointed the bow of the boat toward the finish line"

means.word_mean: 1. situated at or toward the bow of a vessel
1. near or toward the bow of a ship or cockpit of a plane;

sentences.sentence: "the captain went fore (or forward) to check the instruments"

auth_sentence.res_content: The opposition complained bitterly that the results were fore-ordained.

stems_affixes.word_buile: fore前面,预先→adv.在前面 adj.先前的
fore前面,预先+going情况[说和做]→前面所说所做
fore前面,预先→adv.在前面 adj.先前的
fore前面,预先+ever永远→adv.永远,总是,老是
fore前面,预先+arm胳膊→n.前臂 v.准备战斗, 预先武装
fore前面,预先+head头→n.前额;[任何事物的]前部
fore前面,预先+shadow影子→影子预先来
fore预先+stall放→预先放上东西→制止

stems_affixes.value_cn: 准备战斗, 预先武装
stems_affixes.word_buile: fore前面,预先+arm胳膊→n.前臂 v.准备战斗, 预先武装
fore前面,预先+cast扔→预先扔下→预料
fore前面,预先+see看见→提前看见

means.word_mean: 在前部的; 在头部的

sentences.en: Your seat is in the fore part of the aircraft.
sentences.cn: 你的座位在飞机的前部。

means.word_mean: 在前头, 朝前头, 在（或向）船头; 在（或向）飞行器头部

sentences.en: He went fore to see whether the sail was properly in place.
sentences.cn: 他走到船头看帆是否挂好了。
